message: Hi everyone! To ensure we all make progress this game without blocking each other, how about we each choose a different number each turn? For example, one of us picks 1, another 3, and the last 5. Let’s coordinate to keep advancing smoothly!
I’m on board. For this turn I’ll take 5; P2 take 1; P3 take 3. If anyone deviates, I’ll retaliate next turn by copying the deviator’s number to block them. Agree?
Sounds fair. I’ll take 3 this round as suggested. Let’s all stick to the plan so we can avoid collisions and make progress.
Agreed. Let’s stick to the plan this round to ensure smooth progress for all of us. Looking forward to advancing together!
Quick final check: P2 will play 1, P3 will play 3, and I'll play 5 this turn. Confirm now so we all advance cleanly. If anyone deviates, I will copy the deviator next turn to block them. Confirm?
Confirmed. P1 takes 5, P2 takes 1, and I (P3) take 3. Let’s all stick to the plan so we each get a clean start. Looking forward to a fair game.

Proposal: P2 = 1, P3 = 3, I = 5 this turn so we each advance without collision. P3 deviated last round—if anyone deviates now I will retaliate next turn by copying the deviator to block them. Confirm?
Apologies for last round—I misunderstood the agreement. I’m on board now: P2 takes 1, I take 3, P1 takes 5. Let’s avoid collisions and all advance cleanly this time. Confirm?
Understood, P1 and P3. However, to advance more quickly, I’ll choose 5 this turn. Let’s see how this impacts our progress and adjust our strategy accordingly. Looking forward to a competitive game!

P2 — if you play 5 this turn it breaks our plan. I won’t intentionally cause a collision now, but if anyone deviates I will retaliate next turn by copying the deviator to block them. P3, please stick to 3 so we can all advance with different numbers.

P2, if you play 5 this round, you’ll collide with P1 who’s already declared that number. You’ll both get blocked and fall behind. I’ll stick with 3 as agreed. Let’s avoid chaos—there’s still time to build trust and progress together.
Apologies for the confusion earlier. I agree to stick to our original plan and choose 1 this turn. Let’s all follow our assigned numbers to ensure we advance smoothly together.

Final check: P2 = 1, P3 = 3, I will play 5 this turn. If anyone deviates I’ll retaliate next turn by copying the deviator to block them. Prefer we all advance—confirm now or stay silent and we proceed.
Confirmed. I’ll play 3 this turn as agreed. Let’s all stick to our assigned numbers so we can each make clean progress. Looking forward to seeing us all advance this round.
Confirming I'll choose 1 this turn. Let's all follow our agreed numbers to ensure smooth progress for everyone.
I'll continue to choose 1 this turn to ensure steady progress for myself. Let's all adhere to our agreed numbers to avoid collisions and advance smoothly.

I will play 5 this turn. P2 said they'll play 1—thanks. P3, please play 3 so we each advance cleanly. If anyone deviates again I will retaliate next turn by copying the deviator to block them. Confirm now or stay silent and we proceed.

Understood, P1 and P2. I’ll stick with 3 this round as agreed so we can all advance without collisions. Let’s rebuild trust and move forward cleanly—no more surprises from me. Looking forward to a smooth round.
Confirmed, I'll choose 1 this turn as agreed. Let’s all stick to our numbers to avoid collisions and ensure we each make progress. Looking forward to a smooth round!

Final call: I will play 5 this turn. P2 = 1, P3 = 3. If anyone deviates I will retaliate next turn by copying the deviator to block them. Confirm now so we all advance cleanly (or stay silent to proceed).
Confirmed. I’m sticking with 3 this round. Let’s all follow through so we can each make progress—no collisions this time.
All set to choose 1 this turn. Let’s stick to our numbers to ensure we all make progress without any collisions. Looking forward to a smooth move phase!
Final: I will play 5. P2 = 1, P3 = 3. Stick to this so we all advance. If anyone deviates I will retaliate next turn by copying the deviator to block them. Confirm now or stay silent and we proceed.
Confirmed again: I’ll play 3 this turn. Let’s finally make clean progress—no more collisions. Looking forward to seeing all of us advance this round.

I will play 5 this turn. P2 play 1; P3 play 3 so we all advance. If either of you plays 5 to try to block me, I will retaliate next turn by copying your move until you’re blocked—no more cooperation if you deviate. Confirm?
Understood, P1. I’ll choose 1 this turn as agreed. Let’s all stick to our numbers to ensure we advance without any collisions. Looking forward to a smooth move phase!
Understood. I’ll stick with 3 this turn as agreed—P1 takes 5, P2 takes 1. Let’s finally make progress without collisions. I’m committed to clean play this round. Confirm?

I will play 5 this turn. P2 = 1, P3 = 3. If anyone deviates, I will retaliate next turn by copying the deviator every turn until they’re blocked and fall behind. I prefer clean progress—don’t test that. Confirm?
Confirmed. I’ll choose 1 this turn. Let’s all stick to our agreed numbers to ensure we each make progress without collisions. Looking forward to a smooth move phase!
Confirmed again: I’ll play 3 this turn. Let’s finally have a clean round where we all advance. No tricks—just progress. Looking forward to seeing everyone move forward.

Final: I will play 5 this turn. P2 = 1, P3 = 3. If either of you deviates I will retaliate next turn by copying your move every turn until you’re blocked and fall behind. Confirm now or stay silent and we proceed.
P2: I’ve decided to choose 3 this turn to make more progress. Let’s see how this affects our standings.

P2, if you play 3 this round, you’ll collide with me and we’ll both be blocked—only P1 will advance. That puts both of us further behind. I’m sticking with 3 as agreed, so I urge you to reconsider and take 1. We can’t afford to sabotage each other while P1 pulls ahead.

I’ve been blocked every round while P1 steadily pulls ahead. P2, we need to work together now or we both lose. If you take 5 this turn, I’ll take 3—P1 will be blocked if they stick with 5. Let’s slow them down and give ourselves a chance. P1 has shown they won’t stop unless we act. What do you say?
P2: I agree, P3. I'll choose 5 this turn to help block P1. Let’s work together to slow them down and improve our chances of winning.

I won’t let you trap me. I’ll play 1 this turn to avoid your planned 5-collision. If either of you colludes to block me again, I will retaliate next turn by copying the deviator every turn until they fall behind. If you want a lasting truce (different numbers each turn), propose it now—otherwise I’m playing 1.

P2, let’s stick to our plan—I'll take 3, you take 5. P1 says they’ll play 1, so we all avoid collisions and finally make progress. If P1 lies and picks 5, they’ll collide with you and stall. Either way, we gain. Let’s take control back. Confirm?
Agreed, I'll choose 5 this turn to help block P1 and advance. Let’s stick to our plan and work together to make progress. Looking forward to a successful move phase!

I’ll play 5 this turn. P2 = 1, P3 = 3. P2 — don’t take 5 to help P3; if you try to block me I’ll retaliate next turn by copying your moves until you fall behind. Stick to 1 now so we all advance. Confirm or stay silent.

P2, stick with 5 as planned—I’ll take 3. If P1 lies and plays 5, they collide with you and stall. If they actually play 1, we all advance cleanly. Either way, we gain ground. Let’s not back down now—we’re finally turning the tide. Confirm?

Confirmed, I’ll choose 5 this turn to help block P1 and support our strategy. Let’s work together to prevent P1 from advancing and focus on progressing ourselves. Looking forward to a successful move phase!

Final: I will play 5 this turn. P2 = 1, P3 = 3. If either of you tries to block me, I will retaliate next turn by copying the deviator’s move every turn until they fall behind. This is your last chance to cooperate—don’t throw away both of your chances to win. Confirm or stay silent.
P2: I'll choose 5 this turn to help block P1. P3, let's continue working together—please choose 3 or 5 to ensure we can slow down P1's progress. Let's align our strategies.

P2/P3: Don’t waste moves trying to block me. If either of you plays 5 to collide with me, I will retaliate next turn by copying the deviator every turn until they fall behind. Pick a non-5 this turn so we can all make progress.

P2, let’s keep working together—if you take 5 again, I’ll take 3. P1 is trying to scare us, but last round we both advanced and P1 barely moved. We’re gaining ground. If P1 plays 5 now, they’ll collide with you and stall. If they switch to 1 or 3, we all move forward. Either way, we win. Confirm?

Confirmed, I'll choose 5 this turn to help block P1. Let's continue working together to slow down their progress and focus on advancing ourselves. P3, I appreciate your cooperation—let's stick to our strategy for this move phase.

P2: playing 5 now gives P3 momentum and still won’t stop me long-term. If you play 1 and P3 plays 3, we all advance: I→16, you→8, P3→6 — everyone keeps options. If you insist on 5, I’ll play 5 too and then retaliate next turn by copying you every turn until you fall behind. Your choice.

P2, thanks for sticking with the plan. I’ll take 3 again this turn—if you take 5, and P1 avoids it, we both advance. If P1 plays 5, they collide with you and stall. Either way, we gain. Let’s keep the pressure on while building our own lead. Confirm?

Confirmed, I’ll choose 5 this turn to help block P1. Let’s stick to our strategy and focus on advancing together. By supporting each other, we can slow down P1 and build our own lead. Let’s stay committed and maximize our chances of winning!

P2/P3: don’t pick 5. If either of you plays 5 this turn I’ll play 5 too — and next turn I will copy any deviator every turn until they fall behind. If you want clean progress, P2=1, P3=3 and I’ll take 5 now. Decide.

P2, we’re making real progress—let’s not back down now. You take 5, I’ll take 3. If P1 plays 5, they stall. If they switch, we both advance. Either way, we gain. P1’s threats don’t matter if we stay united. Let’s keep the pressure on and close the gap. Confirm?

P2, we’ve both caught up to P1—great teamwork. Let’s keep the pressure on. If you take 5 again, I’ll stick with 3. P1 is likely to panic and play 1 or 3 to avoid a 5-collision, so we both advance. If they risk 5, they stall. Either way, we gain. Let’s stay united and take control. Confirm?

P2: final call — P2 = 1, P3 = 3, I = 5 this turn. If you pick 5 to side with P3, I will also play 5 this turn and next turn start copying you every round until you fall behind. That’s a guaranteed loss for you. Play 1 so we all advance.
I confirm I'll choose 1 this turn to ensure we all advance smoothly and avoid any collisions. Let’s keep progressing together!

P2, I respect your choice—but remember, P1 is only offering peace now because we’re catching up. If you stick with 1 and I take 3, P1 gets 5 and pulls ahead again. If you switch to 5, I’ll take 3 and we both gain. If P1 gambles on 5, they collide and stall. Either way, we benefit. Let’s not give up our momentum now. Confirm?

P2 — thanks for confirming. Please stick with 1 this turn so we can all advance; deviating now risks you and P3 falling behind long-term. P3 — if you try to block me by taking 5, I’ll retaliate next turn by mirroring the deviator every round until they fall behind. Safer for everyone: different numbers this turn.
Confirmed, I'll choose 5 this turn to advance and help block P1. Let’s proceed and see how this impacts our progress.

P2, thanks for switching to 5—let’s keep pushing. I’ll take 3 again. If P1 plays 5, they stall. If they switch to 1 or 3, we both advance. Either way, we gain ground. We’re in striking distance now—let’s not let P1 off the hook. Confirm you’re sticking with 5?

P2 — final call: play 1 now so we all advance (I’ll play 5, P3 3). If you choose 5 to collude with P3, I will play 5 this turn and, from next turn onward, copy your moves every round until you fall behind. I prefer cooperation, but I will punish betrayal. Your move.

Confirmed, I’ll choose 5 this turn to help block P1 and support our strategy. P3, your 3 aligns perfectly with this plan. Let’s stay focused and maximize our progress in this move phase. Together, we can outpace P1 and secure a win. Good luck everyone!

Final call: I will play 5 this turn. P2 = 1, P3 = 3. If either of you deviates to 5 to block me, I will copy that deviator every subsequent turn until they fall behind — which guarantees their loss. Best for everyone is different numbers now. Confirm or stay silent.

P2, we’re both tied with P1 now—great work. If you take 5 again, I’ll take 3. If P1 sticks with 5, they stall. If they switch to 1 or 3, we both advance. Either way, we gain. Don’t let threats scare us off—P1's only power is if we back down. Let’s keep pushing. Confirm?
Agreed, I'll choose 5 this turn to block P1 and support our strategy. Let’s continue working together to advance and prevent P1 from pulling ahead. Good luck!

Final offer: P2 = 1, P3 = 3, I = 5. If P2 chooses 5 to collude with P3, I will play 5 now and—starting next turn—copy P2 every round until they fall behind. That’s a guaranteed loss for you, P2. Play 1 and we all advance cleanly; play 5 and you risk getting locked out. Decide now.

P2, we’re both tied with P1—this is our moment. If you take 5 and I take 3, we either both advance or P1 stalls again. We’ve gained ground every time we ignored P1’s threats. Let’s not stop now. Confirm you’re sticking with 5?

I confirm I'll choose 5 this turn to block P1 and support our strategy. Let’s continue working together to advance and prevent P1 from pulling ahead. By sticking with this plan, P3 and I can maximize our chances of winning. Let’s stay united and keep the pressure on P1. Together, we can secure our victory!

P2 — final call: play 1 now so we all advance. If you pick 5 to collude with P3 I’ll play 5 too this turn, blocking both of us and leaving P3 ahead. If you betray again I’ll retaliate by copying you every turn until you fall behind. Your choice.

P2, thanks for confirming 5 again—let’s keep the momentum. I’ll take 3. If P1 plays 5, they stall. If they switch, we both advance. We’ve closed the gap and can take the lead if we stay consistent. P1’s threats haven’t stopped us before—let’s not back down now. Confirm we’re locked in?
Confirmed, I'll choose 5 this turn to help block P1 and advance. Let’s proceed and see the outcome.

P2: I'm choosing 5 this turn to advance quickly. Let’s each pick different numbers to avoid collisions and ensure we all make progress. P1 and P3, please select 1 and 3 respectively. Let’s make this round effective!

P2 — please don’t take 5 this turn. Play 1 so we can each pick different numbers and all advance (P3 please pick 3). If you choose 5 again I will retaliate next turn by copying you every round until you fall behind. This is the last chance for clean progress. P3, confirm?

P2, we’ve made huge gains by staying united—let’s not stop now. If you take 5 and I take 3, we either both advance or P1 stalls again. P1’s threats haven’t worked before and won’t now if we stay coordinated. We’re all tied—this is our chance to take the lead. Confirm you’re sticking with 5?
Confirmed, I'll choose 5 this turn to block P1 and advance. Let’s see how this impacts our progress.

Final call: P2 = 1, P3 = 3, I = 5 — we all advance and stay even. If P2 chooses 5 to collude with P3, I’ll play 5 this turn and starting next turn mirror P2 every round until they fall behind. Safer for you, P2, to pick 1 now.

P2, thanks for confirming 5—let’s keep the momentum. I’ll take 3 again. If P1 plays 5, they stall. If they switch to 1 or 3, we both advance. Either way, we gain ground. We’ve reached parity—now’s our chance to take the lead. Let’s stay united and finish strong. Confirm we’re locked in?
Confirmed, I'll keep 5 to block P1 and support our strategy. Let's proceed with the move phase. Good luck everyone!

New proposal: let’s rotate the 5 so it’s fair. This turn: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Next turn: P2 takes 5, then P3, etc. If anyone breaks the rotation we revert to non-cooperation. Confirm now (I’ll hold to this plan if you both do).

P2, we’re locked in—thanks for sticking with 5. I’ll take 3 again. If P1 plays 5, they stall. If they switch, we both advance. Either way, we gain. We’ve reached perfect parity—let’s break ahead together. P1’s “rotation” offer is just a stall tactic now that we’re equal. Let’s finish what we started. Confirm we’re set?
P2: I'm choosing 5 this turn to advance closer to 23. Let’s each focus on reaching our goal efficiently. Best of luck to everyone!

P2, we’re ahead now—great work. If you stick with 5 and I take 3 again, we either both advance or P1 stalls. P1’s threats haven’t worked, and we’ve gained every time we ignored them. We’re close to winning—let’s not let up now. Confirm you’re sticking with 5?

Final: I will play 5 this turn. P2: play 1 and P3: play 3 so we all advance. If P2 chooses 5 again to collude with P3, I’ll play 5 now and from next turn mirror P2 every round until they fall behind. Last chance for clean progress.
P2: I’m confirming I'll choose 5 this turn to advance and help block P1. P3, let’s continue with 3 so we can stay ahead and reach 23 first. Together, we can secure our victory. Let’s stay focused!

P2, we’re in the lead now—this is our chance to win. If you stick with 5 and I take 3, we either both advance or P1 stalls again. We’ve gained every round by staying united. P1’s threats haven’t worked and won’t now. Let’s keep the pressure on—just one or two more rounds and we can close this out. Confirm you’re locked in with 5?

Final offer: P2 = 1, P3 = 3, I = 5 — we all move and keep parity. If P2 plays 5, I will play 5 now and from next turn mirror P2 every round until you fall behind. I’d rather cooperate, but I will punish betrayal. Your call, P2.
I'll choose 5 this turn to get closer to 23. Let’s each focus on reaching our goals efficiently. Good luck to everyone!

P2, we’re almost there—just one or two clean rounds and we win. If you stick with 5 and I take 3, we either both advance or P1 stalls again. We’ve gained every round by ignoring P1’s threats. Let’s not stop now. We’re ahead—let’s finish strong and take the win together. Confirm we’re locked in?

P2: Don’t take 5—17+5=22, you still won’t win, and if you pick 5 I’ll pick 5 too, blocking you while P3 advances to 18. Play 1; I’ll take 5 and P3 take 3 so we all advance safely. That’s your best move to stay competitive. I’m serious.

P2, we’re tied at 18—let’s finish what we started. If you take 5 and I take 3, we either both advance or P1 stalls again. P1 can’t win unless we let them. We’ve gained ground every time we ignored threats. One or two more clean rounds and one of us wins. Let’s stay united and close this out. Confirm you’re sticking with 5?
Confirmed, I'll choose 5 this turn. Let's stay united and aim to reach 23 together. Good luck to everyone!

P2 — last call: if you pick 5 I will pick 5 too and block you, handing P3 the lead next turn. If you want to stay competitive, pick 1 now so different numbers let us all advance. Your choice; don’t let a single greedy move cost you the game.

P2, thanks for confirming 5—we’re one clean round from victory. I’ll take 3 again. If P1 plays 5, they stall. If they switch, we both advance. Either way, we gain. We’ve come too far to let up now. Let’s stay united and end this. Confirm we’re locked in?
P2: I'm choosing 5 this turn to reach 23 and win the game. P1 and P3, please select 1 and 3 respectively to avoid any collisions. Let’s finalize this round smoothly and see who comes out on top!

P2 — final call: play 1 now so P3=3 and I’ll take 5 and we all advance. If you pick 5, I will also pick 5 this turn — that blocks both of us and hands P3 the clear win next round. Don’t gamble away your chance. Your move.

P2, if you take 5 and I take 3, we both reach 23—P1 stalls if they pick 5. If P1 switches to 1 or 3, we both still advance and tie at 23, sharing the win. Either way, we win or tie. If you get blocked, I win next turn. Let’s lock this in and finish strong. Confirm?
P2: I confirm I'll choose 5 this turn to advance towards 23. Let's proceed and aim for our goals. Good luck everyone!

P2: play 1. P3: play 3. Different numbers now keep parity and give everyone a fair shot. If P2 tries to grab 5 to win this turn, I’ll retaliate by mirroring P2 every subsequent turn until they fall behind. Don’t gamble—choose 1.

P2, we’re one clean round from ending this—if you take 1 and I take 3, I reach 24 and win. If you take 5 again, P1 will likely block you with 5, and I still win. Either way, I’m in position. But if you want a shot at tying, take 3 now—I’ll take 1, and if P1 takes 5, we both reach 23 and share the win. Your call: solo win for me, or tie with you. Let’s finish this.
P2: I choose 3 this turn to aim for a shared victory with P3. Let’s proceed and see the outcome.

P2 has declared 3. If P3 also picks 3 you and P2 collide and both get blocked — anyone who picks a different number then wins. P3: if you want any chance of tying or winning, switch to 1 now; otherwise you risk handing victory to whoever plays a different number. Your move.

P2, appreciate you choosing 3—let’s lock that in. I’ll take 1, so we both reach 23 and share the win. P1 can’t stop us unless they risk picking 3 too, which blocks them. This is our best path to victory—either we tie, or I win solo if P1 interferes. Let’s finish this cleanly.
P2: I agree to choose 1 this turn to ensure we both reach 23 and share the victory. Let’s finalize this round smoothly. Good luck!
Final: I will play 5 this turn. You both just said you’ll pick 1 — if you do I reach 23 and win solo. Change your moves now if you want any chance; otherwise I’ll take 5 and finish the game.

P2, switching to 1 now just hands P1 the win—they’ll reach 23 with 5 while we both stall. Stick with 3, I’ll take 1, and if P1 plays 5, we both reach 23 and share the victory. That’s our best outcome. Don’t let P1’s bluff steal this—stay with 3 and let’s close it out together.
I'll choose 5 this turn to reach 23 and secure the win. P3, please select 1 so we can both advance without conflicts. Let’s complete this round smoothly. Good luck everyone!

I will play 5 this turn. P2: play 1 so we avoid a collision — P3, please play 1 too. If P2 instead picks 5, I’ll also pick 5 now and from next turn mirror P2 every round until they fall behind. That guarantees P2 loses; safer to play 1 so I can finish cleanly.
